method.name: emulation_ovsdb_config
method.description: This procedure will add OVSDB Controller(s) to a particular Ixia Interface.

description.text: Ixia interface upon which to act.
If this option is selected, this will clear any Ovsdb Controller.
Ovsdb Controller handle for using the modes delete, modify, enable, and disable.

This argument determines if individual interface, session or router handles are returned by the current command. This applies only to the command on which it is specified. Setting this to 0 means that only NGPF-specific protocol stack handles will be returned. This will significantly decrease the size of command results and speed up script execution. The default is 0, meaning only protocol stack handles will be returned.
Action to take on the port specified the handle argument.

choice.choiceText: Adds a new Ovsdb configuration on the port.
Modifies an existing Ovsdb configuration (specified by -handle).
Remove an existing Ovsdb configuration (specified by -handle).
get attribute for existing Ovsdb configuration (specified by -handle).

description.text: attribute name for fetching value.

restriction.value: role errorCode errorTimeStamp errorDesc errorPhysicalSwitchName errorLogicalSwitchName serverAddDeleteStatus latestDumpDbFileNames latestErrorFileNames serverAddDeleteConnectionError bindingStatus progressStatus errorStatus

description.text: Name of NGPF element, guaranteed to be unique in Scenario
Defines the number of ovsdb controller to configure on the -port_handle.
Connection should use TCP or TLS
Specify the TCP port for the Controller
Location of Directory in Client where the Certificate and Key Files are available
Private Key File
Certificate File
Verify Peer Certificate
CA Certificate File
Verify HW Gateway Certificate
HW Gateway Certificate File
Transact request Time Out in seconds. For scale scenarios increase this Timeout value.
Location of Directory in Client where the DumpDb Files are available
If true, Port debug logs will be recorded.
The IP address of the DUT or Ovs Server.
Location of Directory in Client where the ErrorLog Files are available
The IP address of the DUT or Ovs Server which needs to be Added/Deleted.
Bindings Count
Attach at Start
Logical_Switch Name
VNI
Physical_Switch name
Physical_Port name
Indicates the multiplier per VXLAN entity for behind VM clients emulated.
GUI-only connection
GUI-only connection
GUI-only connection
Cluster Data VLAN ID
flag to create full stack. this flag is introduced mainly for Scripgen Issue.

restriction.value: all global manager physical_switch physical_port physical_locator physical_locator_set tunnel logical_switch ucast_mac_local ucast_mac_remote mcast_mac_local mcast_mac_remote

returnValue.value: A list containing the ovsdb controller protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
If failure, will contain more information
Ovsdb Controller Handles Please note that this key will be omitted if the current session or command were run with -return_detailed_handles 0.
Cluster Data Handles Please note that this key will be omitted if the current session or command were run with -return_detailed_handles 0.

notes.note: 1) Coded versus functional specification. If the current session or command was run with -return_detailed_handles 0 the following keys will be omitted from the command response: handle, clusterdata_handle
